summary: The 'Pay Our Correctional Officers Fairly Act' aims to amend Title 5 of the United States Code to increase locality pay for certain Bureau of Prisons employees whose duty stations are located in the 'Rest of U.S.' pay locality. The bill states that the official worksites of these employees will be considered to be located in the nearest other pay locality, with specific guidelines for determining the nearest locality and eligibility.  The bill also clarifies that the definition of 'employee' includes prevailing rate employees.
